artist: Studio of Jean-Pierre Norblin de la Gourdaine
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: bust of long-haired man with large, gaping mouth; wears tall, crooked hat with ties hanging to shoulders, and thick overcoat with rolled collar
marks:
Signature

in graphite on verso: [APG 6780] name in plate at upper left, partially erased: [Re
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until November 26, 1985; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Grotesque Head of a Man in a Tall Bonnet
